commitResults.messageBody: Implement a skeletal version of Cluck that starts by greeting the user, simply echos commands entered by the user, and exits when the user types bye.

commitResults.messageTitle: Now you can mark tasks as done and change them back to not done
Added the following types of tasks: 1. Todos, which only have description, 2. Deadlines with description and due date, 3. Events with description, start and end time

commitResults.messageBody: Use the input/output redirection technique to semi-automate the testing of Duke(or rather, CLUCK)
Adding exception classes to handle errors by Duke
Now you can delete tasks from the todo list with Cluck. Tasks are also now stored in an ArrayList.

commitResults.messageTitle: Made Task class abstract and implemented makeSaveFormat() function
commitResults.messageBody:
Making the Task class abstract ensures that it cannot be instantiated.

The new makeSaveFormat() function is an abstract method in Task, and it is overridden in each child class such that it returns a string that is formatted with respect to the child class for saving tasks.

Now the tasks in the todo list are saved into a txt file with consistent formmating with respect to the type of task.
It also captures the status of the task, whether or not it is marked or unmarked.
Save the tasks in the hard disk automatically whenever the task list changes. Load the data from the hard disk when Cluck starts up.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-8. Added functionality for deadlines to understand date and time and restructure of package
commitResults.messageBody: Instead of saving the due dates of deadlines as strings they are now LocalDateTime objects which uses the java.time.LocalDateTime package

commitResults.messageTitle: Using Gradle to automate building and testing for Cluck
commitResults.messageBody: Added support for gradle to the project as well as denpendencies and tests

commitResults.messageTitle: Changes to checkstyle and addition of JUnit test classes

Added Exceptions for better exception handling

commitResults.messageTitle: Reformatting for files and adding messages as a class
commitResults.messageBody: To allow for better OOP and more packages down the line, the files have been renamed and restructured.

commitResults.messageTitle: Replaced text with strings from Messages package
Created TaskList class and its related exceptions
commitResults.messageBody:
TaskList is created to handle task operations.

TaskIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown when a given index is out of the range of the taskList
TaskNotFoundException is thrown when a task is not found within a taskList (function that throws this is yet to be implemented)

commitResults.messageTitle: Restructure of file to fit OOP standard
commitResults.messageBody:
TaskList related functions are moved from Cluck to TaskList class instead.
Now functions such as populating tasklist by reading saved file are under TaskList

Similarly Task related functions are moved from Cluck to Task class instead.
Added greetUser and farewellUser functions for Ui to display start and end messages for Cluck, using the messages package

commitResults.messageTitle: Created commands package and Command class
commitResults.messageBody: Command class is a abstract class from which all commands will extend from.

commitResults.messageTitle: Created parser package and Parser class
commitResults.messageBody: Parser class will take user input in string format and convert it into its respective executable commands

commitResults.messageTitle: Command abstract class added to commands package
commitResults.messageBody: Command class is the parent class of all command classes, and contains abstract method execute().

commitResults.messageTitle: Changed Command class into and interface instead
commitResults.messageBody: It seems to make more sense for Command to be an interface that commands implement

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactoring of TaskList and Ui class to their respective packages

commitResults.messageBody:
An instantiated Cluck class now contains a Ui instance and a TaskList instance.
Also added start() and stop() functions to start and stop the Cluck instance

commitResults.messageTitle: Parser class now builds commands instead of Cluck

commitResults.messageBody: Ui class' readCommand() now waits for user input by using Scanner.nextLine()

commitResults.messageTitle: Minor fixes to Command interface and MissingArgumentException
commitResults.messageBody: Now the interface method execute() takes in a TaskList and returns a String containing the response
Storage class added under package cluck.storage; Storage class will handle the reading and writing of saved files for cluck

readSave() and writeSave() are now the only functions in storage. buildTaskFromSave() is now under Task class instead (to better follow OOP standards).
TaskList also now supports its own toSave() function so as to not violate OOP standards.

commitResults.messageTitle: Reformatted cluck to fit OOP principles
commitResults.messageBody: Minor fixes to cluck and reformatted to improve readability and abstraction.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added toString() method for TaskList class
commitResults.messageBody: TaskList now can return its tasks in String format
ExitCommand and ListCommand both implements the Command interface. Parser has also be edited to return ExitCommand or ListCommand based on user input

Minor fixes between files as well.
Now Parser creates the commands added based on switch case.
DeadlineCommand, DeleteTaskCommand and EventCommand have been created and Parser now uses them to create commands

Invalid Command added for when user input does not match any known command.

IsNumeric is replaced by IsNotNumeric for better readability
Cluck is now running as intended

Fields in instance of Cluck classare now final.
Added @throw for commandFactory function in Parser class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added test files for gradle and minor fixes
Added serach by keyword method for TaskList and Task
commitResults.messageBody:
containsKeyword() function in Task class returns a boolean value, true if the description of the taks contains the keywrod given in the argument.

findMatches function in TaskList class iterates through its tasks and calls containsKeywords() on the task. If true, it is added to a temp list. The function findMatches then returns a string format of all the tasks that contains the keyword, stored in the temp list

FindTaskCommand contains one field which is the key wrod the user is looking for. It then calls the findMatches() method on the Cluck task list and puts the key word as an argument.
As of now it is not case-sensitive.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modified find Command to be not case-sensitive.
commitResults.messageBody: This is done by converting both the keyword and description in to lower case.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added JUnit test for task checking
commitResults.messageBody:
Tests if savedTasks is properly converted to Tasks by buildTaskFromSave Method in Task class.
Currently only tests on todo.
Tests if given user input "bye", commandFactory produces an ExitCommand.
JavaDocs added to the commited class files.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added dependencies for JavaFX to Gradle
Fix Exit command and merge conflicts in Task class
Make Cluck class extend JavaFx's Application class and created Launcher class
commitResults.messageBody: Cluck class also has a new constructor with no arguments for JavaFx to work properly.
Follows everything up to tutorial 2 of [](https://se-education.org/guides/tutorials/javaFxPart2.html)

commitResults.messageTitle: Created DialogBox class for custom controls
Implemented features for Cluck's dialog box to be interactable
commitResults.messageBody:
- added sendButton.setOnMouseClicked(event) and userInput.setOnAction(event) to trigger handleUserInput() function
- getDialogLabel() function adds text label beside image of dialog box.
- handleUserInput() function controls actions taken after user input.
Cluck's dialog box is now on the left side of the GUI while the user is on the right. This is done by implementing a flip() function in the custom dialog box class

commitResults.messageTitle: Added XML files and restructured the code for better  OOP
commitResults.messageBody:
Classes that make up the Ui are now packages in the Ui package, namely DialogBox and MainWindow

XML files have also been added such that scenebuilder can be used to format JavaFx objects

commitResults.messageTitle: Currently the jar file created with gradle using the shadow plugin is named 'duke.jar' hich is not the Jar file now correctly named
Currently the current  jar file created using the shadow plugin in gradle is named "duke.jar"
commitResults.messageBody:
Eventually the final products name will is "Cluck!"

This is to give it more personality and make it more user-friendly

To acheive this we simply edited the "build.gradle" file and change it such that  'archiveBaseName = Cluck!' under 'shadowJar'.

Currently if the saved file contains a task that is saved in the wrong format, cluck handles it by printing out a statement and the saved task.

To better handle such cases I added a CorruptedDataException which extends cluck exception. Here are the sequence of events after the changes:
1) task build fails in buildTaskFromSave() method in Task class,
2) exceptions are caught
3) CorruptedDataException is thrown containing the error statement and the incorrectly formatted save

There was an additional date time formatter left in the Task class, perhaps a vestige conflict merges.
Now there is only one protected static final DateTimeFormatter which all task related child-classes refer to

Changes were also made to the date time format of the formatter,  changed from "dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm" to "dd-MMM-yy HHmm"

commitResults.messageTitle: Fixes to Storage, Deadline, and Event classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Minor fixes to ensure that Cluck operates normally.

Storage now has a try and catch clause to catch any exceptions when attempting to build a task from save. it catches any cluck exceptions and displays the error message to the user
Branch date time for events

Previously Cluck!'s GUI merely repeated the user input, now it has been fixed such that Cluck! actually takes in the user input and returns a response after executing the command.

This was done by changing the getResponse method in Cluck class which takes in the user input as a String argument and parses it into a command, which is then executed and returns the response from executing the command.
Cluck! now working in GUI

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit to improve code quality in Cluck class
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously Cluck contained high levels of nesting.

Additional methods have been added to improve readability and overall quality of code in the run() method in cluck.
getResponse() is called to get the response from a userInput. getResponse calls two other methods:
getCommand - takes in user input and parses it into a command
executeCommand - takes in a command and executes it, returning the response after executing the command

To acheive this we simply edited the "build.gradle" file and change it such that  'archiveBaseName = Cluck!' under 'shadowJar'.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added assertions in private methods for Cluck
commitResults.messageBody:
Ensure that response obtained after calling getResponse() within run() method is not null.
Ensure that getCommand method in Cluck should not have nuill as an argument.
Added assertions in private methods for Cluck
Updated user guide for Cluck!

commitResults.messageTitle: Restructured Parser class to fit code quality standards
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, the commandFactory method was far too big, and contains too many clauses. This makes looking at the code (much less bug fixing or tracing code) stroke-inducing. Further more, as more possible commands may be added in the future, the commandFactory method will become unbearably long.

To fix this, private methods to build commands for each case have been added. This also ensures that the Same Level of Abstraction(SLAP) is achieved within commandFactory() method.
The methods are named with the simple convention: "build<command_type>", and are pretty self-explainatory in their names. Simple commands such as ExitCommand, ListCommand, and InvalidCommands do not have their own build<command_type> methods as they do not require it.

commitResults.messageTitle: Removed Ui class as it was made redundant with JavaFX

commitResults.messageBody: When user enters nothing in the command line, cluck now response with a joke. Try it out!
NoCommand is a place-holder command for when user does enters an empty string
Branch a code quality2
Currently Cluck! only writes in the svae file when the exit command is given, now the saved file is updated for any command that induces a change in the task list.
